ip-ver-pref.help: On dual-stack system the preferred stack: 4 for IPv4 and 6 for IPv6

addr-timeout.help: On dual-stack system how long to additionally wait for other stack's address in seconds

addr-timeout-mode.help: Address timeout mode; true: wait both stack's addresses; false: wait for preferred stack's address

ppp-enabled.help: Enable support for PPP interfaces (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

ppp-ipv4-enabled.help: Enable support for ipv4 PPP interface (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

ppp-ipv6-enabled.help: Enable support for ipv6 PPP interface (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

use-mbed-trace.help: Use mbed trace for debug, rather than printf

enable-ppp-trace.help: Enable trace support for PPP interfaces (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

socket-max.help: Maximum number of open TCPSocket and UDPSocket instances allowed, including one used internally for DNS.  Each requires 236 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

tcp-server-max.help: Maximum number of open TCP server instances allowed.  Each requires 72 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

tcp-socket-max.help: Maximum number of open TCPSocket instances allowed.  Each requires 196 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

udp-socket-max.help: Maximum number of open UDPSocket instances allowed, including one used internally for DNS.  Each requires 84 bytes of pre-allocated RAM

memp-num-tcp-seg.help: Number of simultaneously queued TCP segments, see LWIP opt.h for more information. Current default is 16.

memp-num-tcpip-msg-inpkt.help: Number of simultaneously queued TCP messages that are received

tcp-mss.help: TCP Maximum segment size, see LWIP opt.h for more information. Current default is 536.

tcp-snd-buf.help: TCP sender buffer space (bytes), see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is (2 * TCP_MSS).

tcp-wnd.help: TCP sender buffer space (bytes), see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is (4 * TCP_MSS).

tcp-maxrtx.help: Maximum number of retransmissions of data segments, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is 6.

tcp-synmaxrtx.help: Maximum number of retransmissions of SYN segments, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is 6.

tcp-close-timeout.help: Maximum timeout (ms) for TCP close handshaking timeout

pbuf-pool-size.help: Number of pbufs in pool - usually used for received packets, so this determines how much data can be buffered between reception and the application reading, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. If a driver uses PBUF_RAM for reception, less pool may be needed. Current default  is 5.

pbuf-pool-bufsize.help: Size of pbufs in pool, see LWIP's opt.h for more information.

mem-size.help: Size of heap (bytes) - used for outgoing packets, and also used by some drivers for reception, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is 1600.

tcpip-thread-stacksize.help: Stack size for lwip TCPIP thread

default-thread-stacksize.help: Stack size for lwip system threads

ppp-thread-stacksize.help: Thread stack size for PPP (obsolete: use netsocket/ppp configuration instead)

num-pbuf.help: Number of non-pool pbufs, each needs 92 bytes of RAM, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is 8.

num-netbuf.help: Number of netbufs, each netbuf requires 64 bytes of RAM, see LWIP's opt.h for more information. Current default is 8.

raw-socket-enabled.help: Enable lwip raw sockets, required for Mbed OS ICMPSocket
